feed.title: My Fishing Blog …
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: ABPMER DELIVERING SEAL DETERRENT PROJECT
entry.content: Seals are notorious for eating catches from fishing gear in areas throughout English waters, resulting in costs to the industry in terms of loss of catch and damaged gear, and impacts on seals that might become entangled in the gear
entry.summary: Seals are notorious for eating catches from fishing gear in areas throughout English waters, resulting in costs to the industry in terms of loss of catch and damaged gear, and impacts on seals that might become entangled in the gear

entry.title: SUSTAINABILITY REVIEW OF AQUACULTURE LEASING!
entry.content: A ‘root and branch’ review of how Scotland’s seabed is leased for aquaculture will aim to promote sustainable development and wider value, Crown Estate Scotland has announced.
entry.summary: A ‘root and branch’ review of how Scotland’s seabed is leased for aquaculture will aim to promote sustainable development and wider value, Crown Estate Scotland has announced.

entry.title: PURE SALMON FINDS SOUL OF JAPAN DISTRIBUTOR

link.title: PURE SALMON FINDS SOUL OF JAPAN DISTRIBUTOR

entry.content: Soul of Japan, the Japanese arm of land-based salmon farming company, Pure Salmon, has secured a distribution partner for the Atlantic salmon from its new facility in Tsu City, Japan.
entry.summary: Soul of Japan, the Japanese arm of land-based salmon farming company, Pure Salmon, has secured a distribution partner for the Atlantic salmon from its new facility in Tsu City, Japan.

entry.title: FISHING SECTOR SLAMS GROWTH IN WINDFARMS!

link.title: FISHING SECTOR SLAMS GROWTH IN WINDFARMS!

entry.content: Representatives from the fishing sector have warned against using the sea as a source of energy, claiming the marine environment is being put at risk
entry.summary: Representatives from the fishing sector have warned against using the sea as a source of energy, claiming the marine environment is being put at risk

entry.title: IRISH ROPE GROWN MUSSELS ACHIEVE MSC LABEL

link.title: IRISH ROPE GROWN MUSSELS ACHIEVE MSC LABEL

entry.content: Ireland’s rope grown mussel fishery has been awarded Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) certification. As certification for both rope-grown and bottom-grown mussels is held by Ireland’s seafood development agency Bord Iascaigh Mhara (BIM).
entry.summary: Ireland’s rope grown mussel fishery has been awarded Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) certification. As certification for both rope-grown and bottom-grown mussels is held by Ireland’s seafood development agency Bord Iascaigh Mhara (BIM).
